title: @Meddler - About some of the things you said 2 months ago.
body:
**First of all, I'm merely asking for a reply from Meddler**, this thread isn't meant to be another huge discussion about Cassio's future - we already had our fair share of those this week. **I'm just looking for a confirmation on something,** here's what I'm talking about:

http://imgur.com/EimMvp3

**Back in october you mentioned the possibility to do some work on Cassiopeia**, primarily on the level of balance. Yes, I realize that the mage-update is going to happen in probably 5-6 months but it's important to keep Cass somewhat playable until that moment has come. It's been over half a year already since you touched her, and those changes were strictly nerfs.

You surely have come to the same conclusion that **she's in a bad spot within a meta that heavily favors snowballing and shorter games**, [and even then her lategame remains subpar.](http://imgur.com/oRdEwtB) **I'm wondering if you have any balance-changes planned for her now that season 6 is about to start.** I already tried talking to your collegue RiotRepertoir about it but he couldn't give any answers since he's not on the Balancing team.

replies.body: I'd say we will have to wait for immobile mages rework. Maybe then, we will see some changes to Cassiopeia.

Do you really think it'd be a good idea to let her rot for 6 more months until finally something happens? The least they could do is to make the current Cass work until she finally receives the desired rework. To simply forget about her is like condemning her to share an apartment with Yorick. **She already suffered through six months of nothing, do you want to make an entire year out of it?**
There is Yorick he has been rotting for 4 years

I'm perfectly fine with that.  Yorick is where the term lane cancer comes from.   Until he's reworked, I'll be more than happy to never see him again.   Which has been the case, I've yet to see him played in months.

I play Yorick if I am on tilt because stomping top lane always gets me off tilt  ALWAYS and I am allowed more mistakes, one last thing, build zzrot portal on him, and split push all game, I was recently in a game agenst a hec and a MF I got my janna and noc to build the portal and we just out rotated the enemy team.

Edit: here it is http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-details/NA1/2062819233/213503587?tab=overview

I know it's already a long time of her being in laughable state, but if Riot already scheduled an "immobile mages" update, and I think Cassio can be easily classified as one, they'll probably not gonna make one exception for Cassio and change her earlier. She is in need of changes, but if they already ignored her for 6 months, I don't think they're gonna care about that. They'll  just throw out changes to her with all other changes to immobile mages. Just saying: don't expect anything until then. Sorry to say that, man.

I just see no point in playing a champion with a powercurve set between a 39% and 50% winrate from early to late if you can play other champions like Zyra, Brand or Rengar who have insanely strong early games (58% winrate) that don't ever fall below a 50% winrate at late.

The powercurve is literally on its head for someone like Cass while she doesn't even get any rewards for making it into late whereas those other champions remain strong throughout the game and also far more reliable in case a game ends a lot sooner.

If you want hypercarries to be viable, they need a 55% winrate at least during lategame, otherwise they remain vastly inferior compared to everyone else. Cassiopeia is simply too weak, mostly due to the handicaps she's stuck with which are her low range, lack of mobility, inherent squishyness and strict focus on single-target-damage along with insane manacosts. Azir is far better than her in that regard.

Seems you're relying a little too much on winrates. Cassio in particular is a tough case because she really needs to be protected in a teamfight because if she's in range, her DPS is even more than Vayne's (pretty sure of it). So imo her late game is fine, her lane just needs a small buff. And i mean small buff. 

Cassio's late game niche is like Ryze or Vayne's. It's basically, if you get in range they will tear you apart. Although Vayne is also a duelist, Cassio has a little extra teamfight in her zoning W and her ult, and Ryze's DPS is slightly AOE and involves CC.

But trading away that cc and tankiness, or stealth and high mobility just for more damage, and then still making that damage very unreliable when comparing a cass pick to a ryze or vayne, it just doesn't work. You don't have the tools to deal your damage and the fact that it might be more damage in an ideal situation doesn't matter because your opponents are actually going to be doing stuff and shut you down nearly every time.

Not just more damage, AOE Hard CC. Her W also gives her more zoning than the other two. Her team fight is better than the other two because her 1 on 1 is so much worse. I think you underestimate just what she can do to someone if she lands her ult; late game she can pretty much 100-0 anyone just off of landing a good ult. Mid game it's pretty much everyone but tanks.

Not denying she is weak right now, but i don't think her niche is as unhealthy as some would make it out to be. It might not match her identity, but it still is fairly healthy gameplay.

WHAT?!

Calling Cass's ult AoE hard cc is very misleading since anyone actually awake can turn around during the animation and turn it into a mediocre slow.

Miasma is a rubbish zoning tool. The damage is completely pathetic, the slow is fairly weak, it takes FOREVER to get up to a decent size and at that point it isn't around for much longer. Kog'maw produces a larger, more relevantly shaped slow field instantly, it deals its damage instantly and deals more than you could ever expect to deal with miasma, and it has a longer range than miasma.

Vayne has a solid source of self peel that she has pre-6, it becomes hard cc way more reliably than Petrifying gaze, and its fail-state is still way more useful.

Ryze likewise has a low-cooldown piece of cc that is hugely useful for him, plus he can stand to get a build that lets him take a hit or two without going down.

Cass's kit is GARBAGE for team fighting. Period. 1v1 late game is all she has but 1v1 doesn't win in the late game. If she Q's a target and it backs up behind a bruiser, she just has to sit and wait for Q to come up again because that bruiser is going to zone her out. If she misfires an E on the wrong target by reflex or due to mobility, then she has to sit and wait for Q and E to come up again. If she misses a Q due to mobility or a bad prediction, she has to sit and wait for Q to come up again AND she loses her movespeed buff.

Every time Cass has been decent since her rework were because the numbers had shifted such that she was strong in the early game like she used to be, because her kit works at bullying, 1v1'ing, and kiting, and is garbage at team fighting. What it's good at can let her get ahead and snowball in the early and mid, if the game comes down to 5v5 fights then she can do her best to get in some pot shots but is overall gimped.

Lol you are getting really worked up about something really stupid. It's a skill shot, so is Varus' ult, so is Orianna's ult, and Nami's ult. It's not misleading, it takes a little skill to land. Saying her kit is bad garbage for teamfighting is just dead wrong. Like, not even close to a legitimate thing. A late game cassio with peel is one of the most threatening things in the game, she can melt an entire team. Q has a low ass CD so it's not exactly much of a punishment to miss

And no, she has been used at IEM for her late game potential and her teamfight potential. She is a low range DPS, with better teamfight than the other two by a wide margin. And a higher DPS than them. Her lane just needs a small buff atm, that is all.

What's next? Nidalee not being OP with her astonishing 40% winrate?

While I don't think she's the worst champion in the game, I do think she's only viable as a jungler and only if you play her a ton. Nidalee is actually really hard to play well and really requires quality teammates to be worthwhile; that's why her winrate has a huge spike in Diamond and she sees some pro play but her overall winrate is abysmal.

Also, are there people that still actually think Nidalee is OP? Most people seem to have moved on to the other assassin cat that inhabits the jungle.

Winrate means absolutely nothing. If you like playing Cassiopea and you play her a lot, you'll find ways to make her viable. I hate when people say that "X champion is weak and needs buffs" or "Y champion is too strong please nerf". You have to learn how to play as and against champions. You can't expect to pick up a difficult champion and win with them all the time after just a few games. 

Likewise, many champions that people complain about are only frustrating because the person playing them ACTUALLY KNOWS WHAT THEY'RE DOING. Any champion, if played well, can be a terror. If a champion is difficult to play, you just have to play them more to understand them better. 

I play a lot of Kassadin for example. Many people complain about how gutted he is after his nerfs, yet I still find success with him in games because I know his strengths and weaknesses and the limits to his power. 

Don't use a champion's poor winrate as an excuse to complain instead of learn.

I'm one of the most dedicated Cassiopeia mains in the world with over 2000 games on her alone, 1500 of those were on her pre-rework self. I know her pretty damn well and I'm telling you, she isn't worth the effort of playing anymore. The risk/reward-ratio is entirely skewed to her disadvantage, she simply isn't viable.

I'd be very careful with buffing Azir.  The way his kit is, any slight buff could make him over the top for professional players.  Regardless, I don't think I can agree with your statement.  Azir's my main/favorite champion (I love everything about him, gameplay/personality/theme) and I find myself doing great most the time.

It is understandable that his learning curve is the steepest in the game (and may indicate a problem) but I just can't see any rationality in buffing him unless it is something related to safety or just very small.  Something minuscule like his W's cast range or his mana costs.  Any buffs to his damage or range would probably not bode well.  

On another note, they could simply bug-fix him.  He has this bug on his W where the auto-attack fails and it's incredibly annoying (as it happens frequently but I cannot reliably reproduce and report it).
